ticket.title: config.gem ignores version
ticket.original-body:
Expected: rails should not allow the server to start if gem versions do not match the ones specified via config.gem
What happened 1.added config.gem "rails",:version => "2.2.2" to config/environments/development.rb my rails version is 2.3.2, no others installed
2. script/server 3. server started as usual
variation :version => ">= 2.9.2", same result
my versions
ubuntu 9.04 64bit ruby 1.9.1p0 rails 2.3.2 gem 1.3.3

version.title: config.gem ignores version

version.body: You can't use rails config.gem stuff to specify the version of rails to load - it's all a bit chicken an egg as by the time you're running that a version of rails has already been picked and booted.
version.body-html: You can't use rails config.gem stuff to specify the version of rails to load - it's all a bit chicken an egg as by the time you're running that a version of rails has already been picked and booted.
version.title: config.gem ignores version

version.body: I get that, but I thought that if would check the already loaded versions against the config.gem defined ones.

version.title: config.gem ignores version

version.body:
The core Rails gems are going to be detected as loaded before config.gem runs, so the current code doesn't even try to do anything with them.
You should use the RAILS_GEM_VERSION constant (in environment.rb) to indicate what version you need.
